name: CVE-2021-33644
description: An attacker who submits a crafted tar file with size in header struct being 0 may be able to trigger an calling of malloc(0) for a variable gnu_longname, causing an out-of-bounds read.
pattern: [(software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:feep:libtar:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:huawei:openeuler:20.03:sp3:*:*:lts:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:huawei:openeuler:20.03:sp1:*:*:lts:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:huawei:openeuler:22.03:*:*:*:lts:*:*:*') OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:fedoraproject:fedora:35:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:fedoraproject:fedora:36:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:fedoraproject:fedora:37:*:*:*:*:*:*:*')]

external_references.description: This object was created using cve2stix from the Signals Corps.
